alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Gallatin and Madison County Mountains and Centennial Mountains; Ruby Mountains and Southern Beaverhead Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:48PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A weak thunderstorm with heavy rain showers will impact portions of southwestern Madison and south central Beaverhead Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 245 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a weak thunderstorm with heavy rain showers 19 miles northeast of Lima, or 27 miles southeast of Dillon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall of up to one inch in an hour with the slow moving storm may cause rapid runoff and minor debris flow down steep terrain, as well as minor flooding of low lying areas and ponding of water on roadways. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Madison and south central Beaverhead Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
